ask_about_symptom.headache: Headache can be caused by stress, dehydration, or lack of sleep. Drink water, rest, and consult a doctor if persistent.
ask_about_symptom.fever: Fever may be due to infection. Take plenty of fluids and rest. If temperature exceeds 102Â°F or lasts more than 3 days, consult a doctor.
ask_about_symptom.cough: Cough can be due to cold or respiratory infection. Stay hydrated and consider consulting a physician if it persists.

query_first_aid.burn: For minor burns, cool the area with running water for 10-15 minutes and cover with a sterile bandage.
query_first_aid.cut: Clean the wound with water, apply an antiseptic, and cover with a clean bandage.
query_first_aid.sprain: Rest the injured area, apply ice, and elevate. Seek medical advice for severe sprains.

ask_about_wellness_tip.exercise: Regular exercise improves overall health. Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate activity daily.
ask_about_wellness_tip.hydration: Drink at least 8 glasses of water a day to stay hydrated and maintain body functions.
ask_about_wellness_tip.sleep: Ensure 7-9 hours of quality sleep every night for physical and mental health.

general_guidance.consult_doctor: Always consult a medical professional for diagnosis and treatment of serious conditions.
